title: Mount Giles
text:
Mount Giles is one of the highest <a href="mountain">mountain</a>s in the <a href="Northern%20Territory">Northern Territory</a>, <a href="Australia">Australia</a>, at . It lies along the <a href="MacDonnell%20Ranges">MacDonnell Ranges</a>, dominating <a href="Ormiston%20Pound">Ormiston Pound</a>, in the <a href="West%20MacDonnell%20National%20Park">West MacDonnell National Park</a>, approximately west of <a href="Alice%20Springs%2C%20Northern%20Territory">Alice Springs</a>. It can be visited via the celebrated <a href="Larapinta%20Trail">Larapinta Trail</a> and has views of <a href="Mount%20Sonder">Mount Sonder</a>, <a href="Ormiston%20Gorge">Ormiston Gorge</a> and Pound, and the surrounding range.
Climbing the mountain requires a hard two- or three-day hike.
